content.text: On the Venn diagrams below, shade the region indicated
Find \(P \cap Q\)
Do not use a calculator in this question
Find the coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve \(y = (2x + 3)^2 (x - 1)\) and the line
Find the value of \(B\) when \(t = 0\)
At the instant when \(\frac{\mathrm{d}B}{\mathrm{d}t} = 1200\), show that \(\mathrm{e}^{4t} - 3\mathrm{e}^{2t} - 4 = 0\)
Using the substitution \(u = \mathrm{e}^{2t}\), or otherwise, solve \(\mathrm{e}^{4t} - 3\mathrm{e}^{2t} - 4 = 0\)
The number, \(B\), of a certain type of bacteria at time \(t\) days can be described by \(B = 200\mathrm{e}^{2t} + 800\mathrm{e}^{- 2t}\)
Given that
can be written in the form \(p^{a}q^{b}r^{c}\), find the value of each of the constants \(a\),
$b$ and $c$
Solve
Find the value of \(\theta\)
Find the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows the right-angled triangle \(OAB\). The point \(C\) lies on the line \(OB\). Angle \(OAB = \frac{\pi}{2}\) radians and angle \(AOB = \theta\) radians. \(AC\) is an arc of the circle, centre \(O\), radius \(12 \text{cm}\) and \(AC\) has length \(9.6 \text{cm}\)
Find the number of different arrangements of the books if there are no restrictions
Find the number of different arrangements if the mathematics books have to be kept together.
Find the number of different arrangements if the mathematics books have to be kept together and the geography books have to be kept together
Eight books are to be arranged on a shelf. There are 4 mathematics books, 3 geography books and 1 French book
there are no restrictions,
there is at least one woman in the team
A team of 6 players is to be chosen from 8 men and 4 women. Find the number of different ways this can be done if
Find the direction in which the pilot must fly his plane in order to reach \(B\)
Given that the distance between \(A\) and \(B\) is \(1250\mathrm{km}\), find the time it will take the pilot to fly from \(A\) to \(B\)

A pilot wishes to fly his plane from a point \(A\) to a point \(B\) on a bearing of \(055^{\circ}\). There is a wind blowing at \(120\mathrm{kmh}^{-1}\) from the west. The plane can fly at \(650\mathrm{kmh}^{-1}\) in still air
Find \(y\) in terms of \(x\)
Hence find the positive values of \(x\) for which \(y\) is defined
Find the exact value of \(y\) when \(x = 3\)
Find the exact value of \(x\) when \(y = 2\)
When \(\mathrm{e}^{y}\) is plotted against \(\frac{1}{x}\) , a straight line graph passing through the points (2, 20) and (4, 8) is obtained
Find, in terms of \(\pi\), the \(x\)-coordinate of \(P\) and of \(Q\)
Find the exact area of the shaded region. You must show all your working
The diagram shows the curve \(y = 4 + 2\cos 3x\) intersecting the line \(y = 5\) at the points \(P\) and \(Q\)
Show that the external surface area, \(S \mathrm{cm}^2\), of the open container is such that \(S = 4x^2 + \frac{2000}{x}\)
Given that \(x\) can vary, find the stationary value of \(S\) and determine its nature
The diagram shows an open container in the shape of a cuboid of width \(x \mathrm{cm}\), length \(4x \mathrm{cm}\) and height \(h \mathrm{cm}\). The volume of the container is \(800 \mathrm{cm}^3\)

The normal to the curve \(y = \left(x - 2\right)\left(3x + 1\right)^{\frac{2}{3}}\) at the point where \(x = \frac{7}{3}\), meets the \(y\)-axis at the point \(P\). Find the exact coordinates of the point \(P\)
